docs.snippet: Researchers have concluded that the Democratic National Committee was breached by two Russian intelligence agencies, and metadata from the released emails suggests that the documents passed through Russian computers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers have concluded that the Democratic National Committee was breached by two Russian intelligence agencies, and metadata from the released emails suggests that the documents passed through Russian computers.
docs.abstract: Release of 20,000 purloined emails from Democratic National Committee's computer servers, bulk of them embarrassing to party leaders, puts spotlight on role of Russian intelligence services, and Pres Vladimir V Putin, in shaking up 2016 presidential campaign; researchers say committee was hacked by two Russian agencies who were behind earlier Russian cyberattacks on federal government in 2015.

headline.main: As Democrats Gather, a Russian Subplot Raises Intrigue
headline.print_headline: In Hacking, Russia Is Accused  of Playing in American Politics

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from Olympic Valley, Calif. Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH

docs.snippet: The gifts he received during his time in the Virginia Statehouse are certain to be cited by Republicans as a sign that Mr. Kaine is not as clean as he portrays himself....
docs.lead_paragraph: The gifts he received during his time in the Virginia Statehouse are certain to be cited by Republicans as a sign that Mr. Kaine is not as clean as he portrays himself.
docs.abstract: Sen Tim Kaine's acceptance of over $160,000 worth of gifts he received while governor and lieutenant governor of Virginia will be scrutinized by Republican critics, citing ethical questions.

headline.main: As Pick for No. 2, Tim Kaine Sees Gifts Come Under Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: As No. 2, Kaine Finds Gifts Subject to Scrutiny

byline.contributor: Eric Lipton reported from Washington, and Steve Eder from New York. Jeremy Merrill contributed research.
byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and STEVE EDER

docs.snippet: Without mentioning Donald Trump by name, first lady Michelle Obama stood before the Democratic convention on Monday and drew a sharp sketch of the Republican nominee that stood in harsh contrast to her gauzy portrait of Hillary Clinton as a woman ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Without mentioning Donald Trump by name, first lady Michelle Obama stood before the Democratic convention on Monday and drew a sharp sketch of the Republican nominee that stood in harsh contrast to her gauzy portrait of Hillary Clinton as a woman who has looked out for children and the disadvantaged all her life.

headline.main: First Lady Draws Sharp Portrait of Trump, Without Naming Him
headline.print_headline: First Lady Draws Sharp Portrait of Trump, Without Naming Him
